class.name: Word.Table
class.description: Represents a table in a Word document.

properties.name: alignment
properties.description: Specifies the alignment of the table against the page column. The value can be 'Left', 'Centered', or 'Right'.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

properties.name: endnotes
properties.description: Gets the collection of endnotes in the table.

properties.name: fields
properties.description: Gets the collection of field objects in the table.

properties.name: font
properties.description: Gets the font. Use this to get and set font name, size, color, and other properties.

properties.name: footnotes
properties.description: Gets the collection of footnotes in the table.

properties.name: headerRowCount
properties.description: Specifies the number of header rows.

properties.name: horizontalAlignment
properties.description: Specifies the horizontal alignment of every cell in the table. The value can be 'Left', 'Centered', 'Right', or 'Justified'.

properties.name: isUniform
properties.description: Indicates whether all of the table rows are uniform.

properties.name: nestingLevel
properties.description: Gets the nesting level of the table. Top-level tables have level 1.

properties.name: parentBody
properties.description: Gets the parent body of the table.

properties.name: parentContentControl
properties.description: Gets the content control that contains the table. Throws an ItemNotFound error if there isn't a parent content control.

properties.name: parentContentControlOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the content control that contains the table. If there isn't a parent content control, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

properties.name: parentTable
properties.description: Gets the table that contains this table. Throws an ItemNotFound error if it isn't contained in a table.

properties.name: parentTableCell
properties.description: Gets the table cell that contains this table. Throws an ItemNotFound error if it isn't contained in a table cell.

properties.name: parentTableCellOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the table cell that contains this table. If it isn't contained in a table cell, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

properties.name: parentTableOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the table that contains this table. If it isn't contained in a table, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

properties.name: rowCount
properties.description: Gets the number of rows in the table.

properties.name: rows
properties.description: Gets all of the table rows.

properties.name: shadingColor
properties.description: Specifies the shading color. Color is specified in "#RRGGBB" format or by using the color name.

properties.name: style
properties.description: Specifies the style name for the table. Use this property for custom styles and localized style names. To use the built-in styles that are portable between locales, see the "styleBuiltIn" property.

properties.name: styleBandedColumns
properties.description: Specifies whether the table has banded columns.

properties.name: styleBandedRows
properties.description: Specifies whether the table has banded rows.

properties.name: styleBuiltIn
properties.description: Specifies the built-in style name for the table. Use this property for built-in styles that are portable between locales. To use custom styles or localized style names, see the "style" property.

properties.name: styleFirstColumn
properties.description: Specifies whether the table has a first column with a special style.

properties.name: styleLastColumn
properties.description: Specifies whether the table has a last column with a special style.

properties.name: styleTotalRow
properties.description: Specifies whether the table has a total (last) row with a special style.

properties.name: tables
properties.description: Gets the child tables nested one level deeper.

properties.name: values
properties.description: Specifies the text values in the table, as a 2D JavaScript array.

properties.name: verticalAlignment
properties.description: Specifies the vertical alignment of every cell in the table. The value can be 'Top', 'Center', or 'Bottom'.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Specifies the width of the table in points.

methods.name: addColumns
methods.description: Adds columns to the start or end of the table, using the first or last existing column as a template. This is applicable to uniform tables. The string values, if specified, are set in the newly inserted rows.

methods.name: addRows
methods.description: Adds rows to the start or end of the table, using the first or last existing row as a template. The string values, if specified, are set in the newly inserted rows.

methods.name: autoFitWindow
methods.description: Autofits the table columns to the width of the window.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Clears the contents of the table.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the entire table.

methods.name: deleteColumns
methods.description: Deletes specific columns. This is applicable to uniform tables.

methods.name: deleteRows
methods.description: Deletes specific rows.

methods.name: distributeColumns
methods.description: Distributes the column widths evenly. This is applicable to uniform tables.

methods.name: getBorder
methods.description: Gets the border style for the specified border.

methods.name: getCell
methods.description: Gets the table cell at a specified row and column. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the specified table cell doesn't exist.

methods.name: getCellOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the table cell at a specified row and column. If the specified table cell doesn't exist, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

methods.name: getCellPadding
methods.description: Gets cell padding in points.

methods.name: getNext
methods.description: Gets the next table. Throws an ItemNotFound error if this table is the last one.

methods.name: getNextOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the next table. If this table is the last one, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

methods.name: getParagraphAfter
methods.description: Gets the paragraph after the table. Throws an ItemNotFound error if there isn't a paragraph after the table.

methods.name: getParagraphAfterOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the paragraph after the table. If there isn't a paragraph after the table, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

methods.name: getParagraphBefore
methods.description: Gets the paragraph before the table. Throws an ItemNotFound error if there isn't a paragraph before the table.

methods.name: getParagraphBeforeOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the paragraph before the table. If there isn't a paragraph before the table, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

methods.name: getRange
methods.description: Gets the range that contains this table, or the range at the start or end of the table.

methods.name: insertContentControl
methods.description: Inserts a content control on the table.

methods.name: insertParagraph
methods.description: Inserts a paragraph at the specified location.

methods.name: insertTable
methods.description: Inserts a table with the specified number of rows and columns.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

methods.name: mergeCells
methods.description: Merges the cells bounded inclusively by a first and last cell.

methods.name: search
methods.description: Performs a search with the specified SearchOptions on the scope of the table object. The search results are a collection of range objects.

methods.name: select
methods.description: Selects the table, or the position at the start or end of the table, and navigates the Word UI to it.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

methods.name: setCellPadding
methods.description: Sets cell padding in points.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.Table object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.TableData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so p
